question: Rahul says, "He is the son of my mother's only sibling." How is Rahul related to the boy?
explanation: Rahul's mother's only sibling is his aunt. The son of his aunt is his cousin.

question: Statement I: Some cats are dogs; Statement II: All dogs are animals; Conclusion I: Some animals are cats; Conclusion II: Some cats are animals
choices: A) A) If only conclusion I follows
B) B) If only conclusion II follows
C) C) If conclusion I and II both follow
D) D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows
explanation: Some dogs are animals, and since some cats are dogs, some cats are animals. No direct link shows all animals as cats but confirms some animals are cats through dogs.

question: Rajesh introduces a man as the son of the only son of his grandfather. How is the man related to Rajesh?
explanation: The only son of Rajesh's grandfather is Rajesh's father. Hence, the man introduced as the son of Rajesh's father is Rajesh's Son.

question: In a linear seating arrangement, five friends A, B, C, D, E sit facing North. Across them sit five others F, G, H, I, J facing South. A sits directly opposite F. C is to the immediate left of A. G is immediately to the right of F. D sits opposite H. I is immediately to the right of H. If A and F, B and G, and C and H swap places, who will be second to the right of the person sitting opposite J?
explanation: After swaps, A is opposite G, B opposite F, C opposite H, D opposite I, E opposite J. Opposite J is E. Second to the right of E is C.

question: Five friends A, B, C, D, and E are seated around a circular table. A sits next to B, who is opposite C. D is between A and E. Who is sitting to the immediate right of C?
choices: A) A) B;B) B) E;C) C) D;D) D) A
explanation: Given the seating arrangement, C is opposite B, making B sit immediately to the left of C and E sit to the immediate right of C.

question: AB_1, CD_2, EF_3, GH_4, _____
explanation: The series alternates between increasing letters in pairs AB, CD, EF, GH followed by increasing numbers 1, 2, 3, 4. Thus, the next pair should be IJ followed by 5.

question: Five friends A, B, C, D, E are sitting in a row facing North. B is between A and C. D is not next to B but is next to E. If they all switch places with their immediate neighbors, who will be second to the right of the person originally sitting second from the left?
explanation: Initially, seating order is A-B-C-D-E. After switching places with neighbors, it becomes B-A-D-E-C. Second from left is now A, and second to the right of A is B.

question: Five friends A, B, C, D, and E are sitting in a row facing north. A sits next to neither B nor D. C is not sitting next to D. B is sitting at one end. If E moves two places to the right, who is now sitting immediately to the left of E?
explanation: Given constraints place B at one end, A next to C but not B/D, and C not next to D. Thus initial seating could be B-C-A-D-E. Moving E two places right makes seating D-A-B-C-E. Hence, A is now left of E.

question: Five friends A, B, C, D, E are sitting in a row facing north. A sits second to the left of B. C sits to the immediate right of D. E does not sit next to B or D. If they rearrange such that A moves two places to the right and D swaps places with E, who will be sitting second to the left of B?
explanation: Initially, arrangement is D-C-A-B-E. After rearrangement: C-A-D-E-B. Second to the left of B is A.

question: AB2, CD4, EF6, GH8, _____
explanation: The series follows a pattern where the first two letters increase by one letter each time (A-B, C-D, etc.) and the number increases by 2 each step (2, 4, 6, 8, 10).

question: Statement I: All cats are mammals Statement II: Some mammals are dogs Statement III: All dogs are animals Conclusions I: Some animals are cats Conclusion II: Some mammals are cats
choices: A) A) If only conclusion II follows
B) B) If only conclusion I follows
C) C) If conclusion I and II both follow
D) D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows
explanation: All cats are mammals does not imply any animal is a cat directly. Conclusion II is true as all cats are mammals.

question: Statement I: All cats are dogs; Statement II: No dog is a bird; Statement III: Some birds are fish; Conclusions I: Some fish are not dogs; Conclusion II: Some cats are not birds
choices: A) A) If only conclusion I follow
B) B) If only conclusion II follows
C) C) If conclusion I and II both follow
D) D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows
explanation: Since no direct link exists between fish and dogs beyond birds, and all cats being dogs excludes them from being birds.

question: Five friends A, B, C, D, and E are sitting in a row facing north. A sits next to B but not next to C. D is between A and C. E is at one end of the row. If E moves two places to the right, who will be on the immediate left of E?
explanation: Initial seating order: E-A-D-C-B. When E moves two places right, the new order is B-E-A-D-C. Thus, D is immediately to the left of E.

question: ABC1, BCD2, CDE3, DEF4, _____
explanation: The sequence follows a pattern where the first two letters of each group become the last two letters of the next group, while the third letter increases by one alphabetically and the number increments by one sequentially.

question: Rahul says, "He is my father's brother's son." How is the man related to Rahul?
explanation: The man is the son of Rahul's uncle, making him Rahul's cousin.

question: Statement I: All dogs are animals Statement II: Some animals are pets Statement III: All pets are friendly Conclusions I: Some friendly are dogs Conclusion II: All dogs are friendly
choices: A) A) If only conclusion I follows
B) B) If only conclusion II follows
C) C) If conclusion I and II both follow
D) D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows
explanation: Not all dogs are pets hence not all dogs are friendly. Some friendly can be animals which include dogs.

question: In a linear seating arrangement, five people A, B, C, D, and E face south while five others M, N, O, P, and Q face north. Q is opposite B and to the left of D. C and N are on opposite sides of the diagonal. E faces O, who is to the right of M. P is to the left of Q and opposite D. M is at one end. If B swaps places with E, E with Q, and Q with B, who will be second to the left of the person opposite O?
explanation: After swapping, the new arrangement for men facing south is C-B-D-Q-A and for women facing north M-P-O-E-N. The person opposite O is now E. Second to the left of E is C.

question: Five friends A, B, C, D, E are sitting in a row facing North. B is between A and C, and D is to the right of C but to the left of E. Who is sitting second to the left of the person sitting opposite to the person sitting second to the left of E?
explanation: In the sequence, A-B-C-D-E. Second to left of E is D. Opposite D is B. Second to left of B is A.

question: Statement I: All dogs are animals Statement II: Some animals are cats Statement III: No cat is a bird Conclusions I: Some birds are not animals Conclusion II: Some animals are dogs
choices: A) A) If only conclusion I follows
B) B) If only conclusion II follows
C) C) If conclusion I and II both follow
D) D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows
explanation: Conclusion I contradicts Statement II; Conclusion II directly follows from Statement I.

question: AB_3, CD_4, EF_5, GH_6, _____
explanation: The first two letters form consecutive pairs in the alphabet. The number sequence increases by 1 each time. Thus, IJ_7 is the next term.

question: Statement I: All cats are dogs. Statement II: No dog is a bird. Statement III: Some birds are fish. Conclusions I: No cat is a bird. Conclusion II: Some fish are dogs.
choices: A) A) If only conclusion I follows
B) B) If only conclusion II follows
C) C) If conclusion I and II both follow
D) D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows
explanation: From Statement I and II, no cat can be a bird confirming Conclusion I. However, there's no direct link proving fish are dogs.

question: AB2, CD4, EF6, GH8, ____
explanation: Each pair of letters advances by one in the alphabet, while the numbers increase by 2. Thus, after GH8 comes IJ10.

question: PQR3, STU5, VWX7, YZA9, _____
explanation: The pattern involves increasing the first three letters in alphabetical order while adding 2 to the number sequence each time. Hence, ABC11.

question: Rajesh says, "He is the brother of my father's only son." How is Rajesh related to him?
explanation: Since Rajesh's father's only son is Rajesh himself, the brother of Rajesh's father's only son is Rajesh himself. Thus, Rajesh is the Brother.

question: AB1, CD3, EF5, GH7, _____
explanation: The first two letters form consecutive pairs in the alphabet while the numbers increase by 2 each time. Thus, the sequence continues with IJ9.

question: Five men A, B, C, D, E face south and five women M, N, O, P, Q face north in parallel lines. Q faces B and is to the left of D. C faces N diagonally. E faces O, right of M. P is left of Q, opposite D. M is at one end. If B and Q, A and E, swap places, who is second to the right of the person opposite O?
explanation: Men: C-E-D-B-A, Women: M-O-P-Q-N. Swapping: Men: C-A-D-Q-E, Women: M-P-O-B-N. Opposite O is A. Second to A's right is E.

question: Rajesh introduces his wife as the sister of the only son of his mother. How is Rajesh's wife related to him?
explanation: The only son of Rajesh's mother is Rajesh himself. Thus, Rajesh's wife is introduced as his sister, making her his Wife.

question: Statement I: Some dogs are cats. Statement II: All cats are birds. Statement III: Some birds are fish. Conclusions I: Some fish are cats. Conclusion II: Some birds are dogs.
choices: A) A) If only conclusion I follows
B) B) If only conclusion II follows
C) C) If conclusion I and II both follow
D) D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows
explanation: From Statement II, some birds are cats but no direct link shows fish are cats. Dogs and cats overlap with birds but no direct fish-dog connection exists.

question: Five friends A, B, C, D, and E sit in a row facing north. A sits next to B but not next to C. D sits next to both C and E. If they rearrange such that A moves two places to the right of their current position, who would be immediately to the left of A?
explanation: Initially, the seating order could be D-C-E-A-B or variations maintaining adjacency rules. Moving A two places right, A ends up between D and E if starting from D-C-E-A-B. Thus, D is immediately to the left of A.

question: Statement I: All cats are dogs; Statement II: Some dogs are birds; Conclusion I: Some birds are cats; Conclusion II: Some dogs are cats
choices: A) A) If only conclusion II follows
B) B) If only conclusion I follows
C) C) If conclusions I and II both follow
D) D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows
explanation: Since all cats are dogs, conclusion II directly follows. There's no information linking birds to cats.

question: Rahul says, “He is the brother of my father’s only daughter.” How is Rahul related to the person he is referring to?
explanation: Rahul's father's only daughter is Rahul's sister. Therefore, the brother of Rahul's sister is Rahul's Nephew.

question: AB2, CD4, EF6, GH8, _____
explanation: The series alternates between increasing the first two letters alphabetically by one and doubling the number following them. Thus, after GH8 comes IG10.

question: Rajesh says, "He is the brother of my mother's only child." How is Rajesh related to the person he is referring to?
explanation: Rajesh's mother's only child is Rajesh himself. So, the brother of Rajesh is Rajesh's brother.

question: Statement I: All dogs are animals.Statement II: Some animals are birds.Conclusion I: Some birds are dogs.Conclusion II: Some animals are dogs.
choices: A) A) If only conclusion I follows
B) B) If only conclusion II follows
C) C) If conclusion I and II both follow
D) D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows
explanation: All dogs are animals confirms conclusion II. There's no information linking birds directly to dogs.

question: In a linear arrangement, six friends A, B, C, D, E, F sit in two rows facing each other. A sits directly opposite D, B sits next to A, and C is directly opposite B. E sits between A and B. If F is directly opposite C, who is sitting to the immediate right of the person opposite F?
explanation: Arrangement: Row 1 (Facing South): E-A-B-C; Row 2 (Facing North): F-D-B-C. Person opposite F is E. To the immediate right of E is A.

question: Five friends A, B, C, D, and E sit in a row facing north. B sits next to neither A nor C. D is between B and E. If A and D swap places, who is sitting to the immediate right of E?
explanation: Initially, the seating order is C-B-D-E-A. After A and D swap, it becomes C-B-A-E-D. Thus, D is immediately to the right of E.

question: AB2, CD4, EF6, GH8, _____
explanation: Each pair of letters progresses alphabetically by two letters, and the numbers increase by 2 each time. Hence IJ10.

question:
Statement I: All dogs are animals
Statement II: Some cats are dogs
Statement III: All cats are mammals
Conclusions I: Some animals are cats
Conclusion II: All dogs are mammals
choices: A) A) If only conclusion I follows
B) B) If only conclusion II follows
C) C) If conclusion I and II both follow
D) D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows
explanation: Since all dogs are animals and some cats are dogs, it follows that some animals are cats. Also, as all dogs are animals and all animals are mammals, all dogs are mammals.

question: Statement I: Some cats are dogs. Statement II: All dogs are animals. Conclusion I: Some animals are cats. Conclusion II: Some dogs are cats.
choices: A) A) If only conclusion I follows
B) B) If only conclusion II follows
C) C) If conclusion I and II both follow
D) D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows
explanation: Some cats being dogs does not ensure all animals include cats. However, it confirms some dogs are cats.

question:
Statement I: All cats are dogs
Statement II: No dog is a bird
Statement III: Some birds are fish
Conclusions I: No cat is a bird
Conclusion II: Some fish are dogs
choices: A) A) If only conclusion I follows
B) B) If only conclusion II follows
C) C) If conclusion I and II both follow
D) D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows
explanation: From Statement I and II, it's clear no cat can be a bird; however, there's no direct link showing fish as dogs.

question: Statement I: All dogs are animals.Statement II: Some animals are pets.Conclusion I: Some pets are dogs.Conclusion II: Some animals are not dogs.
choices: A) A) If only conclusion I follows
B) B) If only conclusion II follows
C) C) If conclusion I and II both follow
D) D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows
explanation: Some animals being pets does not imply any pet is a dog; all dogs being animals does not exclude other animals from being non-dogs.

question: In a circular arrangement, six friends A, B, C, D, E, and F sit around a table. A sits opposite B, C is between A and D, and E is to the immediate right of B. If F swaps places with C, who will sit to the immediate left of A?
explanation: Initially, A faces B, C is between A and D, and E is to the right of B. This makes the order clockwise from A as A-C-D-E-B-F. After F swaps with C, the order changes to A-F-D-E-B-C. Thus, D is now to the immediate left of A.

question: Five friends A, B, C, D, E are sitting in a row facing north. B is between A and C, D is not next to B, and E is at one end. If A and E swap places, who is now second to the left of the person originally next to B?
explanation: Initially: A-B-C-D-E. Next to B: C and D. Swap A and E: E-B-C-D-A. Now, second to the left of C (originally next to B) is A.

question: Rajesh says, "He is the brother of my mother's only son." How is Rajesh related to the man mentioned?
explanation: Rajesh's mother's only son is Rajesh himself. Therefore, the man mentioned is Rajesh's brother, making Rajesh the uncle of the man.

question: Five friends A, B, C, D, E sit in a row facing north. B sits between A and C. D sits next to E but not next to A. Who is sitting second to the right of the person sitting second to the left of E?
explanation: Arrangement is A-B-C-D-E. Second to the left of E is C. Second to the right of C is B.

question: Raj says, "He is the brother of my father's only son." How is Raj related to the person he is referring to?
explanation: Raj's father's only son is Raj himself. So, the brother of Raj is referred to, making Raj the Nephew of the person.

question: Five men A, B, C, D, E face south and five women M, N, O, P, Q face north in parallel lines. Q faces B and is to the left of D. C and N are opposite each other. E faces O, who is right of M. P is left of Q and opposite D. M is at one end. If O and P, A and E, B and Q swap places, who is second to the right of the person opposite the second to the right of P?
explanation: After swaps: Men C-A-D-Q-E; Women M-P-O-B-N. P is at pos 2. Second to P's right is B. Opposite B is Q. Second to Q's right facing South is D.

question: Rahul states, "He is the son of my mother's only sibling." How is Rahul related to the person he is referring to?
explanation: Rahul's mother has an only sibling who is her brother. The son of Rahul's uncle is Rahul's cousin.

question: In a row facing south, five men A, B, C, D, E are seated. Five women F, G, H, I, J face them from a parallel row. G faces C and is to the left of H. E faces I who is to the right of F. H is on the left of J and opposite D. F is at one end. If E and I, A and G, and B and H swap places, who will be second to the right of the person opposite J?
explanation: Initial setup: Men A-E-D-C-B; Women F-I-H-G-J. After swaps: Men A-G-D-H-E; Women F-H-I-J-G. J faces H; second to H's right (viewer's left) is A.

question: Five men A, B, C, D, E face south and five women M, N, O, P, Q face north in parallel lines. Q faces B and is left of D. C and N are opposites. E faces O, right of M. P, left of Q, is opposite D. M is at an end. If O and P swap, A and E swap, B and Q swap, who is second to the right of the person opposite the second person to the right of P?
explanation: After swaps: Men C-A-D-Q-E; Ladies M-P-O-B-N. P is at pos 2. Second to P's right is B (pos 4). Opposite B is Q. Second to Q's right is O.
